author: CatCloud

text:
I disagree with the "Wow-like" graphics comment--I thought D3 was beautiful--but you're absolutely right about the game's atmosphere. It didn't even come close to Diablo II's. The villains in D2 are much more sinister, and having the story told from Marius's point-of-view worked brilliantly.

Plus, let's be honest--D3's soundtrack has a few great songs here and there, but none of them compare to any of Uelmen's compositions for Diablo II.
author: Ashley Shepard

text: i had microsleep while playing this. that game was so boring, and the charakterdevelopment so shitty. not even the cutscenes and music could make me go further than act 2.
author: AdlerSchwadron

text: Well, the later patches did a good job in my point of view. The paragon leveling system does nicely and gives you a good opportunity to gain new gear, the monster levels (0-10) an extra challenge to the hardcore fans (and again, better chances for loot). You don't need the auction house anymore if you don't want to use it.

The music is fantastic though.

author: Locojameseo

text: For me what ruined diablo 3 was how much they took away your freedom of choice. In D2 you could do pretty much whatever you wanted, paladin with only energy leveled, was possible but not viable. In D3 however, you have the "stats @lvl X" because of auto leveling, and beside that all classes only used 2 stats :P And lastly, diablo 2 had better atmosphere, somehow, the rather "wow like" graphics just dont fit diablo series.

author: CaptainFoxButt

text:
Indeed. I mean a lot of people shelled this game with a lot of hate. But the game was quite high standard and i put in about 75 hours of enjoyment for a 50 euro. thats pretty okay :P 
But yeah, if you compare it to the expectations that it had attached to it. It never stood a chance. 
I feel the saddest part of the soundtrack was that there was nothing on par with the old "tristram theme"
author: Mike Thatcher

text: Also my biggest disappointment of the year. The road to lvl 60 was awesome and took me a month. Then I realized I was spending most of my endgame time on the Auction House scouting for cheap equipment instead of actually playing the game. I loved my Witch Doctor and still think Diablo III's gameplay is close to perfection, but I thought this would be my #1 GOTY and that I'd be playing it for years to come. #9 is still a good spot, but it's not enough for the sequel to one my favorite games ever.
author: SupraDarky
